intro: Antigramma repanda var. discreta, commonly known as the slender antigramma, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lygerniaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant features delicate, lance-shaped leaves with a smooth texture and a pale green color. Its small, white flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom during the warmer months. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique appearance.
